intro: Acmella iodiscaea, commonly known as the red bugseed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy, ovate leaves and produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
